title: Fix membership applications not displaying in admin panel

requirements.text: Investigate and fix the data flow issue preventing pending membership applications from displaying in the AdminManagementPage, ensuring that submitted applications appear in the admin panel's Membership Applications section

quotes: I see the apply for membership  but do not see the application in admin

acceptanceCriteria: When a user submits a membership application, it is successfully stored in the backend
The AdminManagementPage displays all pending applications with applicant name, bio, and submission date
Admin users can see and interact with approve/reject buttons for each application
Console logs or debug output confirm data is flowing correctly from backend through usePendingApplications hook to the UI

requirements.text: Verify that the backend getPendingApplications() function returns applications in the correct format expected by the frontend usePendingApplications hook
acceptanceCriteria: Backend getPendingApplications() returns an array of application objects
Each application object includes all required fields: applicant principal, name, bio, timestamp, and status
The return type matches the type expected by the frontend hook

requirements.text: Add error handling and user feedback to the AdminManagementPage Membership Applications section to display meaningful messages when no applications are found or when fetch errors occur
acceptanceCriteria: Display a clear message when there are no pending applications
Show error messages if the usePendingApplications hook fails
Include loading states while applications are being fetched

constraints: Preserve the single-actor backend architecture in backend/main.mo
Do not modify files in frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/components/ui
Maintain existing console logging for debugging that was added in previous versions
nonGoals: Implementing application filtering or search functionality
